title: Pas Normal Studios
description: Copenhagen-based brand creating technical cycling clothing with a contemporary aesthetic. Combining performance materials with refined design across road and gravel collections.

title: MAAP
description: Melbourne-born performance cycling brand pairing advanced fabrics with bold design. Products are developed with athletes and engineered for training and racing.

title: Rapha
description: Global cycling brand making high-quality apparel and accessories for every ride. Builds community through stories, events and the Rapha Cycling Club (RCC).

title: Assos
description: ASSOS of Switzerland has engineered cycling equipment since 1976. Known for pioneering textiles and performance-focused bib shorts, jerseys and outerwear.

title: Pedaled
description: Japanese brand founded in Tokyo creating functional apparel for adventure and endurance riding. Designed for ultra-distance racing, bikepacking and everyday exploration.

title: Le Col
description: British performance brand producing race-bred road apparel with an emphasis on speed and comfort. Kits are developed and tested with professional riders.

title: Café de Cycliste
description: French brand from Nice crafting technical apparel for road, gravel and adventure. Distinctive designs inspired by the Côte d’Azur, blending performance with refined style.

title: Velocio
description: US brand focused on performance, fit and responsible manufacturing. Minimalist designs with technical fabrics and a commitment to sustainability.

title: Attaquer
description: Sydney-based brand known for bold graphics and race-ready performance. Limited drops and collaborations paired with high-spec kits for training and racing.

title: Isadore
description: Slovakian brand founded by former pros creating merino-rich, responsibly made apparel. Designed for comfort on long rides across road and gravel.

title: Universal Colours
description: London-based brand producing progressive cycling apparel with responsible materials and transparent sourcing. Modern palettes and inclusive design approach.

title: Ostroy
description: New York-based brand blending art, culture and cycling with distinctive graphic jerseys. Performance apparel with playful, design-led prints.

title: Heavy Pedal
description: US brand born from fixed-gear culture, offering cycling kits and streetwear-inspired designs. Urban aesthetics meet practical pieces for riding and everyday wear.

title: Trikoterie
description: Vienna-based Austrian brand making colorful cycling apparel with responsible European production. Small-run designs that celebrate creativity on and off the bike.
